title: Calling someone "Autistic" is a really dumb insult for League
body:
So what makes you better at video games?

Social skills _or_ math?

Obviously not Social skills

And those who are diagnosed with Autism often struggle with understanding social rules and cues but are proven to be extremely proficient at math, science, engineering, and other like subjects. Famous individuals such as Einstein, Tesla, and Mozart (to name a spare few) were thought to have Autism or a similar social defect.

While calling someone Autistic in real life indicates that you're calling them socially inept and/or immature, calling someone Autistic in a video game where social skills matter much less is kind of like saying "you're intelligent".

And while you are going to need social skills to co-operate with your team in League- No wait, you aren't because you can ping.

Thus concludes why you should consider calling someone "stupid" rather than "Autistic" (unless you are a psychiatrist).

######Cue the downvotes.

Riot only punishes the most toxic of people.

Using labels derrogatively _**is**_ major fucked up shit.

That's why we punish people for calling people or things 'gay' in place of a word for 'bad' and it's why we don't tolerate the N-word on the NA server.

"those who are diagnosed with Autism often struggle with understanding social rules and cues but are proven to be extremely proficient at math, science, engineering, and other like subjects"

Links to the proof? No? Why weren't the patients I was working with during my internship proficient?

Nothing is "proven" in science, that's what the principle of falsifiability is. There is also no serious research suggesting a causal link between the ability to do mathematics/science and autism. The only articles suggesting these links are correlational studies at best, which still don't explain whether or not the ASD is linked to any type of mathematical ability or if there is a third (possibly more) hidden factor trailing along.

Autism is used as an insult because it suggests not just stupid, but mentally retarded. That is not necessarily true, but try explaining that to a salt-driven chimpanzee whose bronze rank equals his number of brain cells. Similarly, the ape species in this game like to abuse yet another term, cancer. "X gave me cancer". I don't know where this trend began, seeing that it's not even funny, it just makes it obvious your tiny butt cheeks wouldn't even handle a tick, let alone a tumor.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention did report that 46% of all Autistic people had above-average intelligence.  If you want to know the gist of things head here https://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/topics/autism-spectrum-disorders-asd/index.shtml .

It's also possible you were working with people who had Heller's Syndrome(Child Disintegrative Disorder) so they could've missed a lot of years of development.  It's 1 in 100,000 but a very real possibility.

There could be a lot of factors aiding in that statistic.  It could be the tendency to repeat things thus helping memory,  just having good memory in general, or a desire to be good at SOMETHING.  "I'm awful at interacting with other human beings, so screw em.  I'mma be a computer instead!  Hand me that calculus textbook!"
Technically 49% of the worlds population has above average intelligence.

>It doesn't however have any implications 

I may be wrong here, but _"doesn't imply"_ and _"doesn't have any implications"_ don't mean the same thing.

im·ply
imˈplī
verb
strongly suggest the truth or existence of (something not expressly stated).

im·pli·ca·tion
ˌimpləˈkāSH(ə)n/
noun
plural noun: implications
1.
the conclusion that can be drawn from something, although it is not explicitly stated.

Do note that implication DOES have two meanings: the action or state of being involved in something.

doesn't imply means that it does not imply _x_ but it does imply _y_

doesn't have any implications means it does not have any implications

I assume this is what you mean?
